newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends up on spreads, commercial buying.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends up on spreads, commercial buying.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended up on active spreading and commercial buying, traders said.

"Cargill was on both sides of the market but a net buyer of deferreds and more than 1,500 contracts spread," a trader said. Market on close hedges weighed on November. About 450 Nov-Jan spread at $4 then $3.20, 400 Jan-Mar $2, 500 Nov-Mar $6, Mar-May $1.50, Jan-Nov '97 $34.50. November crush margin rose to -38.06 from -39.79 on Tuesday. Volume was 8,255 lots.
Japan bought 5,000 tonnes overnight, sources said.
November canola rose $2.10 to $406.50, January was up $1.50 to $409.50.
November flax lost $0.20 to $367 on hedges.
December feed wheat rose $1.20 to $175.30, March up $0.50 to $172.50 on commercials buying from Cargill. Dec-Mar $2.50.

November barley rose $0.60 to $148, February fell $0.40 to $149.10 with Cargill buying, Midland Walwyn selling, traders said. Alberta Wheat Pool sold the Nov-Feb spread $1.30. Feb-May spread at $0.50, Nov-May $1.50, sources said.
UGG bought December peas up US$2 to US$199 from LFG, traders said.
(All values in Canadian dollars except peas, oats).
